text: The Stephen Hui Geological Museum The Stephen Hui Geological Museum () is the first and only geological museum in Hong Kong. It is located on the ground and first floors of the James Hsioung Lee Building (), in the University of Hong Kong Main Campus. The museum is part of the Department of Earth Sciences, the only earth sciences department in Hong Kong. With the goal of making the rock collection available for public viewing, the museum opened on January 16, 2009. It houses around 10,000 catalogued specimens from different parts of the world. The museum is open from Mondays to Fridays, 1PM to 6PM, with mornings reserved for guided group tours. ==External links== * Museum official website Category:Geology museums Category:University of Hong Kong Category:Natural history museums in China Category:Natural history museums Category:University museums in Hong Kong
